section.title: Problem
section.para: You want create topic oriented documents with the assembly element manually.

section.title: Solution
section.para: In its simplest form, an assembly file contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The root element of an assembly file. It is bound to the DocBook 5 namespace http://docbook.org/ns/docbook.
Wrapper element for a collection of topics. Each topic is identified by a resource element and its xml:id or fileref attributes:
An assembly file can contain more than one resources elements.
Wrapper element for a document to be assembled. Primarily it contains of modules which refers to a resource elements.

section.para: The following example assumes, the files are composed of topic root elements, except for the glossary.xml file (which is comprised by a glossary element).
section.screen: <assembly version="5.1" xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook"> <resources> <resource fileref="intro.xml" xml:id="intro"/> <resource fileref="kde.xml" xml:id="kde"/> <resource fileref="gnome.xml" xml:id="gnome"/> <resource fileref="glossary.xml" xml:id=""/> </resources> <structure xml:id="user-guide"> <output renderas="book"/> <module resourceref="intro"/> <module resourceref="kde"/> <module resourceref="gnome"/> <module resourceref="glossary"/> </structure> </assembly>
